lines.text: This check seems to be made out to "selfish, arrogant dickhead."
Yeah, they'll cash it. They know it's you.
Look out Nashville, cause I'm here now and I ain't never leavin'!
How many Beatles are there?
Three... and Ringo.
[Kyle runs into back of a guy's car and a crowd gathers]
Didn't you see the stop sign?
That's my song!
Well, that's my car!
That's my song playing on the radio!
You wrote that song?
Yeah!
You're a better songwriter than you are a driver.
That's my song!
That song's all right.
Kinda makes ya wanna pat your foot, doesn't it?
You shoulda patted the brake one time.
That's my song!
You got two hits in one day!
You Know Kyle Davidson, there's something you never knew about me.
What's that?

[she kisses him]
You could have had me for a song
Look out Music City, cause here I am and I ain't never leavin'!
Hey Kyle Davidson!
Hey Linda Lue, is that your pretty face I'm seein'?
Well it ain't nobody's butt.
I'm going to go write some more of those good songs.
Yeah, write a good one for me.
I write them *about* you.
You're always asking everyone else what they think.
That's right. And you know what? I'm not going to do it anymore. If I don't feel like bein' nice to somebody, I'm just goin' to be mean... or at least impolite.
You want me to tell you how I feel about you?
Yeah.
Okay, okay. Uh, sometimes you hear a song on the radio and it's just the song you want to hear right then, and then it's over and you're just glad you heard it.
And I'm like that song?
No, you're nothing like that song. You're like if that was the only song in the world that I could hear for the rest of my life. You're that song.
This didn't have to get ugly
And what about... me?
You want to come all the way to Memphis just to sit around and watch me record? I thought you'd want to stay here. settle into our, house...
And do what?
do what? don't know. What does one do anywhere? There's a number of things you could do... write songs... birdwatch.

[sitting in the truck]
Okay, come on. Lets go.
We can't just leave, we've gotta at least let them know we've changed our mind... the preachers on his way and it's raining...
No, no, no, no. Look, uh, we'll just... We'll have a fight, and i'll pretend to slap you... or shoot you in the leg or something...
...Got a better idea.
...What?
Let's... get married.
You don't just get married as a joke.
It's not a joke. It's a journey.
Hey. You know, I don't appreciate you including me in your lie back there. Especially without asking me.
Well, that's a fine point to make. Thank you.
Okay.
There might be a song in that.
Huh?
I was gonna ask you out for a beer, but i've since changed my mind.
What is that? Some kinda line?
Yes.
Does it work?
Sometimes. Rarely.
I'll bet.
I might change my mind again...
Maybe you should change your line.
